name: Moonspell
comments: Gothic metal band formed in 1989 under the name of "Morbid God". They changed their name in 1992.

name: Joey Welz
comments: Member of Bill Haley and The Comets for a time circa 1964-65, and with various Comets reunion groups from 1981 onwards. Prolific recording artist since the late 1950s with most of his albums and singles self-released.

name: Men at Work
comments: Australian pop rock band founded in 1978 which achieved international success in the 1980s. They are the only Australian artists to reach the Number 1 position in album and singles charts in both the United States and the United Kingdom with "Business as Usual" and "Down Under".

name: Lazlo Bane
comments: Alternative rock band from Santa Monica, California, well known for collaborating with former Men at Work member Colin Hay, and providing the song "Superman" as the theme for the television show 'Scrubs'. Also features Robert "Chicken" Burke on drums.

name: Captain Sky
comments: Funk and soul bassist, singer and songwriter

name: Chakachas
comments: Group of Latin Soul studio musicians from Brussels around bandleader Gaston Bogaert and active from the end the 1950s till the end of the 1970s. Apart from bandleader Bogaert  on percussion (conga and tumba), the other members of the band were Kari Kenton (vocals and maracas), Vic Ingeveldt (a Dutchman from Liege on  saxophone), Charlie Lots (trumpet), Christian Marc (piano) Henri Breyre (guitar and backing vocals) and Bill Raymond on bass guitar.

name: George Clinton
comments: Soul and funk music singer-songwriter, musician and producer

name: Lyn Collins
comments: Soul singer. A protégé of James Brown and part of the James Brown Revue in the 1970s. Brown named her "The Female Preacher".

name: The Dramatics
comments: Soul vocal group from Detroit, Michigan

name: The Escorts [US-NJ]
comments: Vocal group from Rahway State Prison in New Jersey.

name: Bobby Russell
comments: Best known as a country-pop songwriter; Russell was also a performer.  Not to be confused with the lyricist Bob Russell .

name: Guy
comments: R&B and hip-hop group. One of the pioneers of New Jack Swing.

name: Leon Haywood
comments: Funk and soul singer, songwriter and record producer

name: Instant Funk
comments: Disco, soul and funk music group

name: Lafayette Afro-Rock Band
comments: Funk rock band formed in Roosevelt, Long Island, New York, which relocated to Paris, France, in 1971

name: Slave
comments: Ohio funk band popular in the late 1970s and early 1980s. Active from 1975 till 1996.

name: Sound Experience
comments: Funk band from Baltimore, Maryland. Led by lead vocalist Arthur Grant, and comprised of Johnny Groman, Reginald Wright, Gregory Holmes, Leroy Frailing, James Lindsey, Anton Scott, and Melvin Miles.

name: The Soul Searchers
comments: R&B and funk music group from Washington D.C.

name: Billy Stewart
comments: R&B, soul and rock singer, pianist and drummer

name: Marva Whitney
comments: Funk singer; she was one of James Brown's 'Original Funky Divas'

name: Roy Ayers
comments: Vibraphonist.  Ayers has played in many musical genres, including jazz, soul jazz, acid jazz, disco, house and R&B.

name: The Blackbyrds
comments: Rhythm and blues and jazz-funk fusion group.

name: The Boogie Boys
comments: Founded by Kool Ski and Kid Delight.

name: The Trammps
comments: Disco and soul band based in Philadelphia

name: Age of Chance
comments: Alternative rock-dance crossover band from Leeds

name: Dread Zeppelin
comments: Led Zeppelin tribute band in a reggae style

name: Groove da Praia
comments: Chill out and bossa studio group

name: Karen Souza
comments: La Pampa area born, Los Angeles-based jazz singer, best known for her work on the popular jazz and '80s series, which featured sultry, jazz-infused covers of '80s hits. Souza also contributed to '70s and '90s versions of the series as well.

name: Steve Vai
comments: Masterly rock guitarist, born in Long Island, New York.

name: Ituana
comments: Bossa nova and chill-out group, based in Los Angeles, California

name: John Corabi
comments: Hard rock music singer-songwriter, guitarist and raconteur

name: Boyd Bennett
comments: Boyd Bennett was singer, band leader and musician born in Muscle Shoals, Alabama and raised near Nashville, Tennessee. In the 1940s he was a band and nightclub singer. In the early 1950s he formed his band, 'The Rockets' and played country, honky tonky and western swing music. He is best known for his rock 'n' rolll hits made later in the 1950s.

name: Pat Shannon
comments: Pop vocalist, active from the end of the 1950s till the early 1970s

name: Kitty Kallen
comments: Singer from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania popular in the 1940s into the early 1960s.  Kallen was the female vocalist in a number of dance and swing bands.

name: Suicide Machines
comments: Punk rock/ska band from Detroit, MI

name: Minus Story
comments: Indie rock/pop band from Lawrence, Kansas

name: Architecture in Helsinki
comments: Musical collective formed in Melbourne in 1999.

name: Helmy Kresa
comments: German-born songwriter and the principal arranger and orchestrator for Irving Berlin

name: Zolof the Rock & Roll Destroyer
aliases: Zolof the Rock and Roll Destroyer

name: Murder by Death
comments: Indie rock / alt. country band founded in 2000 in Bloomington, Indiana

name: Adi Braun
comments: Jazz / cabaret vocalist, originally from Germany

name: Stan Freberg
aliases: Stan Freberg and his Sniffle Group
comments: Comedian, voice actor and advertising creative director from Pasadena, California

name: Panic! at the Disco
comments: Since 2015, only Urie is the official member of the band.

name: Golden Boys
comments: Vocal quartet formed in 1958, composed of brothers Roberto, Ronaldo, and Renato Correia José Maria and a cousin, Valdir Anunciação.

name: Les Missiles
comments: Pop quartet from Oran (Algeria) consisting of Bernard Algarra, Manu Gonzales, Robert Suire and Micky Ségura.

name: Fernand Bonifay
comments: Composer and songwriter, who was very successful in the 1950s and 1960s

name: The Cheers
comments: Vocal trio from California. Members included Bert Convy, Gil Garfield and Sue Allen.

name: Nicoletta
comments: Yé-yé singer, active since the mid-1960s

name: Maurice Vander
aliases: Maurice Vander et son piano jazz

name: Time in Malta
comments: Hardcore/experimental band from San Francisco, California.

name: Every Time I Die
comments: Metalcore band from Buffalo. Inducted into the Buffalo Music Hall of Fame in 2019.

name: Horst Winter
aliases: Horst Winter mit seinem großen Orchester

name: Hans Lang
comments: Composer of traditional Viennese songs and soundtracks for Austrian movies and occasional singer

name: Bert Reisfeld
comments: Pianist, singer, composer, lyricist and arranger.

name: Betty Hutton
comments: Stage, film and television actress, comedian, dancer, and singer, known as "the blonde bombshell" for her hair color and her manic performing style

name: Mark Mueller
comments: Musician (piano), songwriter, lyricist, writer and TV-producer, from Alameda County, California

name: The Beverley Sisters
comments: Harmonic vocal trio from London, consisting of three siblings. They reportedly hold the record of being the longest-surviving vocal group of all time without a lineup change.

name: Shelly Peiken
comments: Songwriter, backing vocalist, pianist and guitarist

name: Meredith Brooks
comments: Rock music singer- songwriter and musician

name: Steve Pippin
comments: Country music songwriter, (session) singer, and actor.

comments: Rock band - early sound was characterised by psychedelic elements, later fused blues, rock and gospel

name: Tex Williams [US]
aliases: Tex Williams and His Western Caravan

name: Peepshows
comments: Punk rock 'n' roll band from Örebro

name: Tocotronic
comments: Hamburg based indie band founded in 1993. Considered a relevant part of the "Hamburger Schule" movement.

name: Red Planet
comments: Power pop/rock band from San Francisco

name: Eugene Maslov
comments: Jazz pianist and composer.  Maslov is a naturalized citizen of the United States.  He was born in Russia and immigrated to the United States in 1989.

name: Rob Taylor [GB]
comments: Pop and rock vocalist based in Germany

name: Tortoise
comments: Combine krautrock, dub, minimal music, electronica and jazz into their music

name: Roland Shaw
comments: Composer, arranger and bandleader, mainly associated with the Decca label

name: The Saints [AU]
comments: One of the first and most influential Australian punk groups

name: Bob Morrison
comments: Singer and songwriter from Biloxi, Mississippi. Inducted in the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2016.

name: Ma Rainey
aliases: Ma Rainey – Acc. By Her Georgia Band
Ma Rainey - Acc. by Her Georgia Jazz Band
Ma Rainey - Acc. Tub Jug Washboard Band
Ma Rainey and Her Georgia Band

name: Angel Fernandez
comments: Music  Director, trumpeter, arranger and composer

name: Silver Surfers

name: Backwood Creatures
comments: Pop punk band from Koln, Germany

name: Arkkon
comments: London-based industrial music producer and performer

name: Treponem Pal
comments: Though both band names refer to the Syphilis virus, this French Industrial/Metal band, formed in Paris 1986, should not be confused with the Brazilian Metal band of the same name.

name: The Ditty Bops
comments: Band from Los Angeles, California headed by Abby DeWald (vocals and acoustic guitar) and Amanda Barrett (vocals, ukulele, mandolin and dulcimer). Their music incorporates a variety of musical styles such as folk, bluegrass, blues, western swing, ragtime and musical theater.

name: Bran Van 3000
comments: Alternative rock collective from Montreal, Quebec.

name: Perri
comments: Female R&B and jazz group, comprised of sisters.

name: Claudio Bisio
comments: Comedian, singer, television presenter and actor

name: Milligram
comments: Stoner rock band from Cambridge, Massachusetts. Active from 1996 till 2002.

name: Tony Reflex
comments: Lead singer for the punk rock band The Adolescents. He has used the pseudonyms Tony Cadena, Tony Montana, and Tony Adolescent, and since 1992 has most consistently credited himself as Tony Reflex.

name: Massimo Riva
comments: Guitarist and singer, leader of Vasco Rossi's backing band.

name: Alex Foster
comments: Saxophonist, known for playing in the 'Saturday Night Live' house band

name: Eric Watson
comments: Jazz pianist now based in France.

name: Mat Marucci
comments: Jazz drummer.  Marucci also writes instructional books and articles on drumming.

name: Andrea La Russo
comments: Songwriter from North Caldwell, New Jersey

name: Joel Hirschhorn
comments: Songwriter, who won the Academy Award for Best Song on two occasions

name: Kelly Rowland
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer and actress, from Atlanta, Georgia

name: Kirlian Camera
comments: Darkwave band.  One of the pioneers of the Italian electronic scene, who have encompassed many genres.  Active from 1979 under the name Suicide Commando, the band changed name in 1980

name: Ian A. Anderson
comments: Folk musician, magazine editor and broadcaster

name: Oscar Woods
comments: Texas blues guitarist, singer and songwriter.

name: Archie Shepp
comments: Principally a jazz saxophonist (primarily tenor), Shepp also plays piano, sings and composes.

name: Eddie Thompson
comments: Jazz pianist; he studied at the same school for the blind as George Shearing .

name: Spike Robinson
comments: Jazz tenor saxophonist whose professional career was interrupted by a 30-year stint as an engineer.  Known for his recordings of ballads from the Great American Song Book.

name: Gioconda Cilio
comments: Multi-genre vocalist born in Syracuse on Sicily.

name: The E-Types
comments: Pop rock band from Salinas, California

name: Armand Van Helden
aliases: Armand Van Helden Presents Old School Junkies

name: The Moonglows
comments: Rhythm and blues / doo-wop group from Cleveland, Ohio

name: Sidekick
comments: Punk rock band from Hollywood, CA

name: Keith Dunn
comments: Boston-born harmonica-player, singer and songwriter, now living in Rotterdam, The Netherlands

name: Gerald Sims
comments: Soul singer, guitarist, songwriter and producer, active in the Chicago soul scene.

name: Os Populares
comments: Instrumental rock group formed in Rio De Janeiro

name: Mamonas Assassinas
comments: Comedy rock band from Guarulhos. On March 2, 1996, the plane in which the band was traveling crashed near São Paulo, causing the death of all five band members

name: Russ Morgan
aliases: Music in the Russ Morgan Manner
Russ Morgan and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Russ Morgan
Russ Morgan and His Scranton Seven
Russ Morgan and His Velvet Violins
Ted Wilson and His Orchestra [Russ Morgan]
comments: Vocalist and bandleader born in Scranton, Pennsylvania

comments: Rock and roll duo, pioneers of surf music

name: Bardot
comments: Group formed for the first series (2000) of the Australian TV program 'Popstars'.

name: Robert Ponger
comments: Producer and songwriter best known for his working with Falco.

name: Doug Hopkins
comments: Guitarist and songwriter.  Hopkins was the co-founder of the Gin Blossoms from which he was fired due to his alcoholism.  He committed suicide in 1993 by gunshot.

name: Glen Phillips
comments: Alternative rock singer, songwriter, and guitarist

name: Natchez Trace
comments: Folk music band. Third member is Roger Knowles (vocals, rhythm guitar).

name: Eddie Calvert
aliases: Eddie Calvert His Trumpet and His Orchestra
Eddie Calvert (The Man with The Golden Trumpet)
comments: Easy listening/pop/pop-jazz trumpeter.  Calvert vehemently disagreed with the policies of the Harold Wilson Labour government, particularly toward Rhodesia, and ultimately moved to South Africa.

name: Hugo Winterhalter
comments: Easy listening music band leader, composer, arranger and producer

name: Pálmi Gunnarsson
comments: Bass player and vocalist, who also participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 1986 as part of ICY, a vocal trio consisting of Gunnarsson, Helga Möller and Eiríkur Hauksson. They were the first Icelandic entrants into the Eurovision Song Contest appearing at the 1986 finals in Bergen, Norway.

name: Perturbazione
comments: Indie pop rock band formed in Rivoli.

name: Editors
comments: Indie rock band founded in 2002 in Stafford, Staffordshire and based in Birmingham.

name: The Edison Military Band
comments: Band formed in 1911 by Edwin Franko Goldman later known as the famous The Goldman Band. The New York Military Band that recorded for Edison Records was formerly known as the Edison Military Band. The name was changed beginning with Edison Records 9948 released in October, 1908.

name: The Eyeliners
comments: Pop punk band from Albuquerque, NM

name: Renato e Seus Blue Caps
comments: Rock band from Rio de Janeiro

name: Marduk
comments: Self description: The most brutal and blasphemous metal act ever.

name: Roger Lima
comments: Born in Brazil and raised in Gainesville, FL

name: Spanky Wilson
comments: Soul, funk, and jazz vocalist.  Wilson has lived in Paris since 1985.

name: Wailin' Elroys
comments: Rockabilly & hillbilly band from Athens, Ohio. Consists of Bram Riddlebarger, Justin Rayner and "Preacher" Zeb Dewar.

name: Jeremy Spencer [GB]
comments: Blues rock guitarist and singer. One of the founding members of Fleetwood Mac.

name: Agnetha Fältskog
comments: Singer, songwriter, musician and actress who achieved success in Sweden after the release of her self-titled debut album in 1968, and reached international stardom as a member of the pop group ABBA, which has sold over 380 million albums and singles worldwide, making them one of the best-selling music artists in history.

name: Don Chapel
comments: Country music songwriter and occasional singer

name: The Harptones
comments: Vocal harmony group from Harlem, New York City

name: Raoul Cita
comments: Rhythm and blues pianist, (occasional) singer, arranger, and songwriter

name: Richie Davis
comments: Doo wop and rhythm and blues singer and songwriter from Harlem, New York City.

name: Joe Martin [US1]
comments: Doo wop and rhythm and blues singer and songwriter from Harlem, New York City

name: Ralph Martin
comments: Doo wop and rhythm and blues singer and songwriter from Harlem, New York City.

name: Tony Middleton
comments: Doo wop and rhythm and blues singer and songwriter from Harlem, New York City.

name: Morty Craft
aliases: Morty Craft and the Singing Strings
comments: Musician, orchestra leader, producer and label owner

name: Blanket Music
comments: Eclectic band based in Portland, Oregon.

name: Kill Your Idols
comments: Hardcore punk band from New York

name: Jordin Sparks
comments: Winner of the sixth season of American Idol in 2007

name: Puffy
comments: Pop rock duo from Tokyo, formed in the mid-1990s

name: The Big 3
comments: Folk trio. Although they were fairly well-known, making a total of twenty-six television appearances in less than two years, they became even more famous posthumously, when Tim Rose launched a successful solo career and Cass Elliot joined The Mamas and The Papas.

name: Dave Evans
comments: Country singer, banjo player and songwriter.

name: The Sons of Adam
comments: Garage rock band from Baltimore, Maryland, who re-located to Los Angeles.

name: Jean Stapleton
comments: Actress, best known for having portrayed Edith Bunker, the long-suffering yet devoted wife of Archie Bunker, on the 1970s sitcom All in the Family .

name: Danny Meehan
comments: Actor who appeared in both musical and non-musical stage productions

name: John Lankston
comments: Singer/actor in opera and on Broadway.

name: Ney Matogrosso
comments: Vocalist famous for his outlandish costumes, make-up, daring movements and his uncommon sopranino voice

name: A.A. Milne
comments: English author best known for his books about the teddy bear Winnie-the-Pooh and for various poems.  He was a noted writer - primarily as a playwright - before the huge success of Pooh overshadowed all his previous work. He was the father of bookseller Christopher Robin Milne upon whom the character Christopher Robin is based.

name: Alisha's Attic
comments: Pop duo of sisters Shelly and Karen Poole.

name: Monica Himmelstrand
comments: Arranger occasionally also writing or translating songs.

name: Paris Bennett
comments: R&B singer and former 'American Idol' contestant.

name: Gina Glocksen
comments: Ninth-place finisher on the sixth season of American Idol in 2007

name: Don & The Goodtimes
comments: Garage rock band from Portland, Oregon

name: Jenny Lou Carson
aliases: Jenny Lou Carson and Her Tumbleweed Troubadours
comments: Country music singer and songwriter, who was inducted into the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame

name: The Loved Ones [US1]
comments: Oakland, California Mod R&B group, active in the 1990s

name: Bruce Bromberg
comments: Grammy Award winning songwriter and producer of blues music. 2011 inductee to the Blues Hall of Fame. Co-founder of HighTone Records .

name: Scott Mathews
comments: Singer-songwriter, musician, drummer, entrepreneur and producer

name: The Souther, Hillman, Furay Band
comments: Country rock supergroup led by singer-songwriters Richie Furay, Chris Hillman and J.D. Souther. The band recorded two albums during the 1970s before breaking up due to disagreements between the members.

name: LaKisha Jones
comments: Singer who placed fourth on the sixth season of American Idol in 2007

name: Build an Ark
comments: Jazz collective based in Los Angeles.

name: Hardrock Gunter
aliases: Hardrock Gunter and His Town & Country Music
comments: Guitarist, singer and songwriter, and an ancestor of both early rock and roll and rockabilly. His song "Birmingham Bounce" from 1950 is a contender for the title as first rock and roll record.  Gunter's nickname has nothing to do with the music he plays; instead, Gunter acquired the nickname when the trunk of a van fell on his head, causing him no apparent discomfort.  Gunter left the music business in the 1960s to go into insurance, but started performing again in 1995.  He is also a master storyteller.

name: Gary Gentry
comments: Songwriter. Gentry carries a guitar and a typewriter in his truck and writes when he’s not driving. Gary Gentry is a flatbedder. Has been for 20 years. He’s also a country music songwriter.

name: Danny Darst
comments: Country music singer-songwriter and movie actor.

name: Pete Goble
comments: Bluegrass musician and prolific songwriter born in Kentucky, and spent his adult life in Michigan.

name: Bill Emerson
aliases: Bill Emerson and The Sweet Dixie Band
comments: Highly-regarded bluegrass five-string banjo player, singer, and songwriter born in Washington, D.C. Not to be confused with another country musician often credited as Bill Emerson, Wild Bill Emerson , and who was born in the same year. "Wild Bill" is the person who wrote the non-bluegrass country songs for people like George Jones and Hank Williams, Jr.  Bluegrass Bill Emerson only composed bluegrass songs.

name: Jimmy Vivino
comments: Blues guitarist, keyboard player, singer, producer and songwriter. Best known as part of the 'Max Weinberg Seven' on tv's 'Late Night with Conan O'Brien'.

name: Bill Bruford
comments: Drummer, percussionist, composer, producer, and record label owner.

name: Shannon Hoon
comments: Singer, composer. Died of a drug overdose at the age of 28.

name: Rogers Stevens
comments: Rock music guitarist, pianist, keyboardist and attorney

name: Rhythmstick
comments: One off latin jazz fusion project. In Japan, this album was marketed as "CTI All Stars". Principal participants included Benny Golson, Jim Beard, Bob Berg, Anthony Jackson, Phil Woods, Art Farmer, Charlie Haden, Dizzy Gillespie, Flora Purim, Airto Moreira, Marvin "Smitty" Smith,  Romero Lubambo, Jon Faddis & Randy Brecker.

name: Bob Gaddy
comments: East Coast blues and rhythm and blues pianist, singer and songwriter

name: Blue Meanies
comments: Ska band from Chicago, IL. Formed in 1989, broke up in 2001 but reuniting evey now and then since 2004 to play a few concerts a year.

name: Long Beach Dub Allstars
comments: A dub reggae / ska / rock band.

name: Frédéric François
comments: French-speaking singer-composer living in Belgium and born in Lercara Friddi on Sicily

name: The Wheels [GB]
comments: Beat band from Belfast, Northern Ireland. The Wheels used the name The Wheel-A-Ways in the US, apparently to avoid confusion with The Detroit Wheels .

name: Herbie Armstrong
comments: Northern Irish guitarist, singer and songwriter

name: Lifetime
comments: New Jersey based hardcore / punk band

name: Ilona Knopfler
comments: Paris born jazz/pop vocalist alternating living in Atlanta and Paris.

name: Drag the River
comments: Alt-Country band from Fort Collins, Colorado

name: The 69 Eyes
comments: Rock band formed in Helsinki. Initially their style was glam metal and hard rock, however later works began to incorporate elements of gothic rock.

name: Ms. Fits
comments: All female Misfits tribute band from Los Angeles.

name: Glenn Evans
comments: Drummer, record label owner, and songwriter

name: Relayer
comments: Neo-prog band from Libertyville Illinois, formed in 1991.

name: Penguin Cafe Orchestra
comments: Multi-membered acoustic ensemble blending folk, classical and minimal music. Penguin Cafe Orchestra's album covers were painted by Emily Young, an artist and sculptor who is also the Emily in See Emily Play .

name: Jerry Livingston
comments: Songwriter and pianist, TV and film composer in the 1950s and 60s. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1981.

name: Fred Spielman
comments: Songwriter born in Vienna, Austria. He emigrated to the United States in 1938, and worked in Hollywood in the 1940's and 50's, chiefly for Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

name: Frankie Lymon
comments: Doo-wop singer and the first black teenage star

name: Paul Buff
comments: Sound engineer, technician and self-taught pioneer in the field of independent record production in the early 1960s

name: Ian Whitcomb
aliases: Ian Whitcomb and His Dance Band
Ian Whitcomb and His Orange Blossom Orchestra
comments: Singer, songwriter, pianist, ukulele player, author, record producer, and actor

name: Willie Woods
comments: Soul and R&B singer-songwriter and guitarist

name: Ruy Guerra
comments: Composer and film director. Guerra was born a Portuguese citizen in Lourenço Marques (today Maputo) in Mozambique, when it was still a Portuguese colony.

name: Pierre Grosz
comments: Lyricist, author, librettist, literary translator and writer

name: Shuki Levy
comments: Israeli-American music composer and executive producer

name: A Whisper in the Noise
comments: This group is a musical project of film composer West Thordson.

name: You Should Play in a Band
4 Skins
comments: Punk rock band from London. Formed in 1979 and split in 1984. Reformed in 2008.

name: Adam Ant
comments: English singer, musician, songwriter and actor

name: Pink Martini
comments: Multi-member cross-genre orchestra from Portland, Oregon

name: Full Speed Ahead
comments: Punk rock/hardcore band from New Jersey

name: Gas Huffer
comments: Garage rock band from Washington state

name: The Andrews Sisters
comments: A highly successful close harmony singing group of the swing and boogie-woogie eras. Throughout their long career, the sisters sold well over 75 million records and had 113 charted Billboard hits, 46 reaching Top 10 status (more than Elvis Presley or The Beatles). The group was inducted into the Vocal Group Hall of Fame in 1998.

name: Eight to the Bar
comments: Retro swing to soul music band from Connecticut

name: Captain Stubby
aliases: Captain Stubby and The Buccaneers featturing the Buccaneer Trio

name: Friedrich Hollaender
comments: Film composer and author, who was born in London, where his father, operetta composer Victor Hollaender, worked as musical director at the Barnum & Bailey Circus. In 1899 Hollaender's family returned to Berlin, his father began teaching at the Stern’schen Konservatorium, where his son became a student. He had to leave Nazi Germany in 1933 because of his Jewish descent, first moved to Paris and emigrated to the US the next year, where he wrote the music for over a hundred films. He thus had extensive credits in film and for the stage both in Germany and the US with four Academy Award nominations.

name: Sammy Lerner
comments: Songwriter with extensive credits in film including cartoons. After moving to the UK in 1936, he also wrote for musicals.

name: Diefenbach
comments: Originally a post-rock instrumental band upon its formation in 1999, Diefenbach soon adopted an indiepop sound with vocals

name: Ray Gilmore
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer and radio industry executive.

name: Kathy Valentine
comments: Blues guitarist, best known as bassist for the Go-Go's

name: Frank Scott
comments: Musical arranger, pianist and harpsichordist for Lawrence Welk and His Orchestra (from 1956 to 1969)

name: Paul Vance
comments: Singer, songwriter - with over 300 recorded songs - and record producer

name: Lucien Morisse
comments: Music industry executive, talent scout and lyricist.

name: The Cheats
comments: Punk rock 'n roll band from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

name: Pisser
comments: Rock n' roll band from New York

name: Sixdeep
comments: Hip hop/rock group from New York Also known as Six Deep

name: Dave Barbour
aliases: Dave Barbour and His Orchestra with Male Chorus
comments: Jazz banjoist and guitarist, songwriter and actor.

name: Tony Galla
comments: Versatile singer, guitarist and songwriter from Buffalo, most known as lead-singer from the band "Raven". In 1998, he was inducted into the Buffalo Music Hall of Fame.

name: Louis Gossett Jr.
comments: Actor born in Coney Island, Brooklyn, New York City

name: Supercharger
comments: Lo-fi garage rock band from San Francisco

name: George Motola
comments: Record producer, record label owner and operator, sound engineer and songwriter

name: Rickie Page
comments: Singer and songwriter born in Lindsay, Oklahoma. She recorded releases on Liberty, Dot, Zephyr and Rendezvous. Sometimes recording with her sister Sonya and sometimes with some combination of her three daughters, she also put records out on Con, Landa, Decca, Epic, Era, Fleet, Hit, Landa, Spar, United Artists and VIP using a huge variety of aliases including "The Georgettes". The name of the latter "group" was based on the name of Page's spouse.

name: Mark Linn
comments: Singer, songwriter and actor. Married to the Danish actress Anne Sofie Espersen.

name: Merry Go Round [NO]
comments: Rock and roll band from Oslo

name: moi Caprice
comments: Indie band formed as a high school band named "Concrete Puppet Frog". After a hiatus of appr. 10 years, the band reformed in 2020.

name: DumDum Boys
comments: Rock band. Named after an Iggy Pop song.

name: Peace Brothers
comments: Trio from Berlin, specializing in covers.

name: The Quakes
comments: Psychobilly band from Buffalo, New York. Formed in 1986.

name: The League of Decency
comments: Retro swing/rockabilly band from Atlanta, GA

name: The Revolvers [DE]
comments: Punk rock band originally founded in Bochum in 2000 and disbanded in 2005.

name: Demisemi Quaver
aliases: デミセミ・クエーバー

name: フラフラスキッピーズ
Steve Bell
comments: Singer and songwriter of Christian folk music

name: The Fevers [BR]
comments: Rock band that were part of the "Jovem Guarda" movement. Their music style is called "iê iê iê".

name: Lílian Knapp
comments: Singer, songwriter and translator of lyrics. She was a member of the duo "Leno e Lílian".

name: Ronnie Von
personal_name: Ronaldo Lindenberg Von Schilgen Cintra Nogueira
comments: Singer, songwriter and television show host.

name: A Bolha
comments: A Bolha (The Bubble) is a rock band that formed in 1965 as The Bubbles.

name: Paul Joseph Moore
comments: Musician, producer, composer, and writer. He was one of the founders of the Glasgow sophisti-pop group The Blue Nile, and the keyboards and synthesizer player of the band from 1981 to 2004. These days, he is playing with his group PJ Moore & Co.

name: Claudia Mori
comments: Singer, songwriter, actress and music producer

name: Bruce Roberts
comments: Singer-songwriter based in Los Angeles, California

name: ZZ en de Maskers
comments: Beat band formed in Amsterdam and headed by Bob "ZZ" Bouber. In 1965 Bouber and his band split up and the band continued as 'De Maskers'.

name: Blind Guardian
comments: Power metal band from Krefeld. Often considered one of the most influential and critically acclaimed bands in power and speed metal genres. Their lyrics are mostly based on fantasy novels and mythology, but some of their songs about biblical themes have caused them being considered a Christian band.

name: Mark Collie
comments: Country singer, songwriter, guitarist and actor.

name: The Renegades [GB1]
comments: Beat band originally from Birmingham. They enjoyed popularity in Scandinavia and then in Italy.

name: John Brim
aliases: John Brim and His Gary Kings

name: Bachman-Turner Overdrive
comments: Rock band feat. Fred Turner and three Bachman brothers. The second and most commercially successful lineup featured lead guitarist Blair Thornton, in place of Tim Bachman.

name: Jaymz Bee and the Royal Jelly Orchestra
comments: Lounge music and jazz band formed in Toronto

name: David Benoit
comments: Smooth jazz and jazz fusion pianist

name: The Brady Bunch
comments: Fictional family from sitcom of the same name, created by Sherwood Schwartz that originally aired from September 26, 1969, to March 8, 1974, on ABC TV. The series revolves around a large blended family with six children.

name: Samantha Sang
aliases: Samantha Sang and Rocked the World

name: Robert Plant
aliases: Robert Plant and the Sensational Space Shifters

name: Little Walter
aliases: Little Walter and His Night Caps
Little Walter and His Night Cats
comments: Blues harmonica player, singer and composer, who was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's sideman category in 2008

name: The Drovers Old Time Medicine Show
comments: Hillbilly band formed in 1987 in South Carolina.

name: Madeleine Peyroux
comments: Jazz and blues singer, songwriter and guitarist from Athens, Georgia. In her late teens, Peyroux was part of The Lost & Wandering Blues and Jazz Band, a group of street musicians led by Daniel William Fitzgerald. She debuted there as a singer on CD 'Spreading Rhythm Around' circa 1992.

name: LK
comments: Alternative rock band. Also features Derry's brother Leigh, his cousin Richard, and his girlfriend.

name: Jonathan Richman
aliases: Jonathan Richman and The Modern Lovers

name: Bill Janovitz
comments: Alt. rock guitarist, singer, songwriter and music writer.

name: OP8
comments: One-off collaboration of Howe Gelb, Joey Burns and John Convertino.

name: The Love Affair
comments: London-based pop, soul, and R&B group

name: Gloria Estefan
comments: Cuban-American singer, songwriter, performer, actress and entrepreneur

name: DHT
comments: Eurodance duo consisting of Flor Theeuwes and Edmée Daenen

name: Lucio Dalla
aliases: Lucio Dalla e il suo complesso
comments: Singer-songwriter from Bologna, who started as a jazz musician before trying his luck as a soul singer. Both moves proved to be commercially unsuccessful, but his black music background was instrumental in the development of his trademark sound (jazzy arrangements, vocal impromptus,...) He is also remembered for his generosity towards fellow musicians, especially from his native region of Emilia: some of them were discovered by Dalla, or signed their first recording deals thanks to his recommendation, or revived their struggling careers after a collaboration with him. Many of his songs are now considered Italian pop classics; outside of Italy, he is perhaps best known for the classical crossover standard "Caruso".

name: Julio Iglesias
personal_name: Julio José Iglesias de la Cueva
comments: Singer and songwriter and former professional football player (goalkeeper). In 1983 Iglesias entered the Guinness Book of Records for having recorded songs in the most languages in the world.

name: Peter Evrard
comments: Pop-rock music singer Season 1 winner of Idool

name: Pierre Kartner
aliases: El Padre Abraham y sus Pitufos
comments: Dutch singer, composer, TV and music producer

name: Peter Alexander
aliases: Peter Alexander und der Koreanische Kinderchor
Peter Alexander und Ute Mann Chor
comments: Actor, singer and one of the most popular entertainers in the German-language world between the 1950s and his retirement in the late 1990s.

name: Swoop
comments: Party band based around lead singer Filip D'haeze.

name: Hervé Vilard
comments: Vocalist, who became famous in the 1960s. One of his first singles, "Capri c'est fini", became an international hit in 1965 and rendered him instantaneously famous. The song sold 3.3 million copies.

name: Angela Lansbury
comments: Film, stage and TV actress who had a long and illustrious career

name: Chilly Pop
comments: Other members are Nicoline Hummel, Steven De Lie and Chantal Brack. Music for children between 8 and 12 years old.

name: The Strangeloves
comments: Band created by a New York-based songwriting production team who pretended to be from Australia.....

name: Riccardo Cocciante
comments: Singer and composer. Born in Saigon (Vietnam) to an Italian father and a French mother.

name: Giorgia
comments: Pop singer, songwriter, and record producer, noted for her wide vocal range

name: Kid Dynamite [US2]
comments: Melodic hardcore punk band based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

name: Sebadoh
comments: Pioneering Lo-Fi band originally formed by Eric Gaffney and Lou Barlow. Gaffney left the project in 1993.

name: Lou Barlow
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer and songwriter, a key figure in the popularization of the so-called "Lo-Fi music".

name: Ladies Who Lunch
comments: Short-lived duo formed by Wiggs and Schellenbach.

name: Ed's Redeeming Qualities
comments: Acoustic alternative folk quartet formed in New Hampshire. Active from 1988 till 1996. ERQ amassed a strong cult following, which hasn't subsided with the band's demise.

name: Spain
comments: Slowcore band formed in Los Angeles, CA. Led by singer/bassist Josh Haden. Disbanded in 2001, then reformed in 2007.

name: Radio Havanna
comments: Neo/political Punk group from Suhl in Thuringia. All band members are presently living in Berlin.

name: The Original Gospel Harmonettes
comments: Birmingham, AL-based female gospel group, led by by soloist Dorothy Love Coates, who also composed many of their best-known selections.

name: Miklós Rózsa
comments: Budapest-born composer and conductor, active in France (1931–1935), England (1935–1940), and the United States (1940–1995). Best known for his nearly one hundred film scores.

name: Robert Denham
comments: Sir Robert Vansittart was a senior career diplomat who wrote the lyrics to 'I Want To Be a Sailor' at composer Miklós Rózsa 's request. He used a pseudonym because his diplomatic status meant he didn't want to use his own name in the on-screen credits.

name: The Satintones
comments: Reportedly the first group ever to record for Motown Reunited briefly in 1990 for one single Coincidentally, members Robert Bateman and Sonny Sanders passed away on the same exact date

name: Mojave 3
comments: Alt-country band, formed by Neil Halstead, Rachel Goswell, and Ian McCutcheon, who all previously played in the band Slowdive. Simon Rowe and Alan Forrester joined after the release of their first album.

name: Chapstik
comments: Punk rock, metal, thrash band from Detroit

name: Voltage
comments: Punk rock band from Austin, TX

name: Electric Frankenstein
comments: Punk and rock 'n' roll band from New Jersey

name: Chrome Cranks
comments: Trash Rock band formed in Cincinnati in 1988 and based in New York City.

name: Bob Mintzer
comments: Jazz multi-instrumentalist who plays most often on tenor saxophone.  Mintzer is also a composer and educator, currently teaching at the University of Southern California.

name: The Green Goblyn Project
comments: American horror punk band, based in Cape Canaveral, Florida

name: Asa-chang and Junray
comments: Experimental music project led by self-taught tabla player Asa-Chang. The name Junray comes from the portable soundsystem "Jun-Ray Tronics", but, when written in Japanese characters, 巡礼 (Junrei) also means pilgrimage.

name: ASA-CHANG
aliases: ASA-CHANG & ブルーハッツ [Blue Hats]
comments: Percussionist, producer, arranger and songwriter. He left Tokyo Ska Paradise Orchestra in 1993 and started working as a session musician. In 1998 he formed the experimental unit ASA-CHANG & Junray. He has played in genres as diverse as Jpop, swing, indie rock and electronic music. His productions and arrangements are often characterized by the use of brass instruments and/or exotic percussions, especially tabla, bongo and... tabla-bongo, an instrument invented by himself that looks like a bongo and sounds like a tabla.

name: Exodus
comments: Thrash Metal band from San Francisco, CA.

name: Tenderloin
comments: Hard rock band based in Lawrence, Kansas

name: Reverend Horton Heat
comments: Psychobilly trio from Dallas, Texas. The group is led by James C. Heath, aka Reverend Horton Heat.

name: Eddy Duchin
aliases: Eddy Duchin & His Central Park Casino Orchestra
Eddy Duchin and His Central Park Casino Orchestra
Eddy Duchin and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Chorestra

name: Will Osborne
aliases: Will Osborne and His Orchestra - Vocal by Will Osborne
Will Osborne & His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Will Osborne
Will Osborne and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Will Osborne and Ensemble
Will Osborne and His Slide Music
comments: Drummer, vocalist and big band bandleader

name: Jazz Jamaica
comments: Jazz-reggae fusion band led by Gary Crosby

name: Reggae Clinic 65
comments: Reggae Clinic 65 was an occasional studiogroup with producer Jacques Albin. Just making some fun, not less, not more. Name refers to the adress of EMI at that time: Rue De Clinique 65 Anderlecht

name: Mable John
comments: Blues singer. Mable was the first female artist signed by Berry Gordy to Motown's Tamla label.

name: Ratt
comments: Hard rock and heavy metal band

name: Robbin Crosby
comments: Heavy metal and hard rock singer-songwriter and guitarist

name: Warren DeMartini
comments: Hard rock and heavy metal guitarist and songwriter

name: Gilbert Montagné
comments: Pianist, organist and singer from the Ménilmontant neighborhood in Paris and Bourbonnais, Blind since birth he is best remembered for "The Fool", which was a #1 single in France and also a hit in Belgium, Spain and Italy in 1971.

name: Matt Cameron
comments: Rock & Jazz drummer from San Diego, CA.

name: Avenged Sevenfold
comments: Heavy metal / metalcore / hard rock band from Huntington Beach, California.

name: Libertine
comments: Dark glam punk band from New York City.

name: Jones Crusher
comments: Punk band based in Long Island, New York. It became The Crusher.

name: T.H.C.
comments: Trip hop band from Los Angeles

name: The Bystanders
comments: Welsh pop band (later psychedelic pop) group

name: George Fischoff
comments: Songwriter. He got a Tony nomination for the musical "Georgy!".

name: Patrick Juvet
comments: Former model turned singer-songwriter, who had a string of hit records in France. Juvet found international success as a disco music performer in the latter half of the 1970s.

name: Il était une fois
comments: Musical group fronted by Joëlle Mogensen as lead vocals. Formed in Paris it included besides Mogensen, Serge Koolenn, Richard Dewitte, Lionel Gaillardin, Bruno Walker and Christian Burguière. Walker and Burguière were later replaced by Jean-Louis Dronne and Daniel Schnitzer.

name: Corky Robbins
comments: Radio and nightclub performer and songwriter

name: Trivium
comments: Heavy metal/thrash/metalcore band from Orlando, Florida

name: Helen Lewis
comments: Singer-songwriter, who started her career in a jazz act with her sister Kay, then recorded for the Motown-owned V.I.P. label in the mid-1960s where both became songwriters.

name: Kay Lewis
comments: Singer-songwriter, who started her career in a jazz act with her sister Helen, then recorded for the Motown-owned V.I.P. label in the mid-1960s where both became songwriters. Kay Miller is her married name.

name: Jimmy James
comments: Soul music/ska singer. Moving to the UK in 1964 with his band, he was one of the earliest ska artists to record in the UK before jumping the disco train.

name: Jacob Miller
comments: Reggae singer-songwriter. Due to his tenor voice and showman qualities still considered one of the greatest Reggae singers. Killed in a car crash in Kingston.

name: Paula Lockheart
comments: Vocal interpreter of classic blues and jazz songs.  Lockheart is also a songwriter.

name: Peter Ecklund
aliases: Peter Ecklund and The Jazz Improvisers
Peter Ecklund and The Melody Makers
comments: Cornetist who has played jazz, pop, rock and blues

name: George Hearn
comments: Actor and singer, primarily in Broadway musical theatre

name: Lostprophets
comments: Alternative rock band from Pontypridd, Wales. Active from 1997 till 2013.

name: Lonnie Gordon
comments: Hi-NRG, house and soul music singer-songwriter, born in Philadelphia and based in New York's Bronx

name: The Finn Brothers
comments: Musical duo consisting of brothers Neil and Tim Finn

name: Michaele [US]
comments: Jazz/pop vocalist based in Manhattan, New York City

name: The Soul Benders
comments: Garage band from Grand Rapids, Michigan.

name: Michel Berger
comments: Composer, singer and songwriter, born in Neuilly-sur-Seine

name: Azie Mortimer
comments: A nightclub singer in Chicago in the 1960s and early 1970s, who performed jazz when appearing live, but recorded primarily as a soul or R&B singer

name: Meg Baird
comments: Folk musician, singer-songwriter, from New Jersey, based in San Francisco, California

name: Lou Stallman
comments: Songwriter and producer active since the 1950s

name: Talamasca
comments: Progressive metal band from Appleton, Wisconsin

name: Corpusse
comments: Corpusse is the experimental, noise and avant-garde solo project of John Ashton.

name: Anonymus
comments: Thrash metal band from Montreal, active since 1989. Anonymus sings in French, Spanish, English and Italian.

name: Scrubmuffin
comments: Alternative rock band from Montreal, Canada

name: GoGoGo Airheart
comments: Postpunk band based in San Diego, California

name: Neil Burke
comments: Punk musician, engineer, graphic designer and visual artist based in Philadelphia

name: Glass Candy
aliases: Glass Candy and The Shattered Theater

name: The Locust
comments: Noise/grindcore band from San Diego, California

name: Weasel Walter
comments: Avant garde/free jazz composer and multi-instrumentalist.

name: The Spacewurm
comments: San Diego, California-based experimental electro artist.

name: Fast Forward [US]
comments: Experimental electro project with John Fones. It was formed around 1999 in Los Angeles.

name: The Convocation Of....
comments: Baltimore-based psychedelic rock band formed by George France, Tonie Joy and Guy Blakeslee in August 1998.

name: Bastard Noise
comments: Claremont, California-based band. Its style has ranged from mostly powerviolence to ambient music.

name: Tourettes Lautrec
comments: Punk band from San Diego, California.

name: Jimmy Tamborello
comments: Indie rock singer-songwriter and musician and electronica music DJ

name: Joe Shamwell
comments: Soul singer, songwriter, producer and radio deejay.

name: Brian & Tony Gold
comments: Reggae vocalist duo formed by Brian Derek Thompson and Patrick Anthony Morrison after becoming 1st and 2nd respectively at a talent contest in 1996.

name: Junior Tucker
comments: Soul, R&B and reggae music singer

name: The Corporation
comments: Team of songwriters and record producers assembled by Berry Gordy in 1969 to create records for the Jackson 5.

name: The Underdogs [US1]
comments: Four-man garage rock band from Grosse Pointe, Michigan. Members: Dave Whitehouse (vocals, bass), Tony Roumell (lead guitar, vocals), Chris Lena (rhythm guitar, vocals), and Michael Morgan (drums, vocals).

name: Jimmy Gateley
comments: Country music singer-songwriter, fiddler and guitarist.

name: George Bennard
comments: Hymn composer and preacher, who is best known for composing the famous hymn "The Old Rugged Cross"

name: The Ray Charles Singers
comments: Choral group formed featured on Perry Como's records, radio shows and television shows for 35 years and who released a series of approximately thirty choral record albums in the 1950s and 1960s for the Essex, MGM, Decca and Command labels.
